text: Surely the godwary will be in the midst of gardens and a river.The worth and exaltedness of that region lies not in roasted chicken, flowing rivers, and women good and beautiful [55:70]. The worth of the oyster lies not in the oyster-the oyster's worth lies in the kingly pearl within. The worth of the house of subsistence lies not in the fact it has edibles and drinkables-its worth and eminence lie in that it has the stamp of proximity to the Real and the mark of election. For it is,
